common_errors.pattern: config.*undefined|no rc file found|empty config object
causes: Wrong app name passed to rc()
solutions: Create .appnamerc in home directory or project
Verify app name matches: rc('myapp') looks for .myapprc
Check rc searches: cwd, home, /etc, /usr/local/etc
Use defaults parameter: rc('app', { defaults })

common_errors.pattern: INI parse error|invalid ini format|unexpected character
causes: RC files use INI format by default
Invalid INI syntax in config file
solutions: Use INI syntax: key = value
Use .json extension for JSON configs
Escape special characters in values
Check for unclosed quotes or sections

common_errors.pattern: env var overwriting|unexpected config value|config from environment
causes: RC converts env vars to nested objects
Case sensitivity issues with env vars
solutions: RC uses appname_ prefix for env vars
appname_foo__bar becomes { foo: { bar } }
Be aware env vars take highest precedence
Use different app name if env collision

common_errors.pattern: CLI args not working|--option ignored|argv not parsed
solutions: Use --option=value or --option value format
Boolean: --flag or --no-flag
Nested: --foo.bar=value
Arguments have highest precedence after env

causes: INI format doesn't natively support arrays
solutions: Use JSON format for array configs
In INI: use multiple entries with same key
Or use numbered keys: item0=a, item1=b
Consider using cosmiconfig for complex configs
